entry.def: A combined effort  or attack is made by two or more groups of people at the same time.

example.ex: These refugees are looked after by the combined efforts of the host countries and non-governmental organisations.
example.tran: 在几个接收国和一些非政府组织的共同努力下，这些难民得以安置。

entry.def: The combined size or quantity of two or more things is the total of their sizes or quantities added together.

example.ex: Such a merger would be the largest in US banking history, giving the two banks combined assets of some $146 billion.
example.tran: 这将是美国银行业历史上最大的一次合并，使两家银行的总资产达到1,460亿美元左右。

means.word_mean: 1. involving the joint activity of two or more;

sentences.sentence: "the attack was met by the combined strength of two divisions"
"the conjunct influence of fire and strong dring"

means.word_mean: 2. made or joined or united into one

Sentence.sentence: But experts say that even when combined , alternative energy sources will likely meet only about 30% of the world's energy needs by 2050.
Rising population combined with improved nutrition standards and shifting dietary preferences will exert pressure for increases in global food supply.
This means, of course, that almost all of the books published in the 20th century are still under copyright – and the last century saw more books published than in all previous centuries combined.

sentences.en: The combined turnover of both businesses has doubled in the last two years.
sentences.cn: 过去两年了，这两家企业的综合营业额翻了一番。
